sentences.english: All of the nations in the pacific rim have been watching China's military developmen¬ts with alarm.
sentences.chinese: 太平洋沿岸國家已經注意到中國軍力壯大的危險。

sentences.english: It is an initiative to have standby forces in each of the regional economic groupings in Africa.
sentences.chinese: 這項計畫由非洲區域經濟團體提供了備戰的軍力。

sentences.english: The object of strategic retreat is to conserve military strength and prepare for the counter- offensive.
sentences.chinese: 戰略退卻的目的是爲了保存軍力，準備反攻。

sentences.english: Palpatine remained sequestered at Byss while he rebuilt his strength, and his Empire.
sentences.chinese: 帕爾帕廷隱居比斯，重建軍力和他的帝國。

sentences.english: I believe China's Military is catching up with the US.
sentences.chinese: 我相信土鱉軍力接近美帝。

sentences.english: "We would always be at the mercy of Israeli arms, " Siniora said.
sentences.chinese: 西尼奧拉說，“我們永遠完全受到以色列軍力的控制。

sentences.english: We will maintain this increased force level for the next 18 months.
sentences.chinese: 我們將在未來18個月內保持增兵後的軍力水平。

sentences.english: To recruit is to re-grow the army.
sentences.chinese: 徵召新兵就是重新使軍力成長的意思。

sentences.english: China has little or no real ability to project its power abroad, yet.
sentences.chinese: 中國至今還沒有或者幾乎沒有能力將其軍力投向國外。

sentences.english: PROTECT】We keep our army to protect our country from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我們保持軍力，以保衛國家免受敵人侵犯。

sentences.english: The deferred, intractable issue is the future of Nepal’s security forces.
sentences.chinese: 這被擱置的棘手議題就是尼泊爾防備軍力的未來。

sentences.english: Syracuse had always had an admirable military and rome had always respected that.
sentences.chinese: 敘拉古軍力不弱，羅馬一向知道這一點。

sentences.english: But China’s military advances do unnerve neighbours and regional rivals.
sentences.chinese: 但是中國的軍力增長卻使鄰國和地區對手神經緊張。

sentences.english: Lacking the military power to protect far-flung sea lanes , China feels vulnerable.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏軍力保護漫長的海上航線，中國有脆弱之感。

sentences.english: Master Mamon gives people material wealth and military power.
sentences.chinese: 地的主宰瑪門給的是物質上的豐盛和軍力。

definition: peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to take turns/to work by roster
